intro: Phyllanthus carnosulus, commonly known as the fleshy phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
